Nitady Foana ary ilay raha ary zavatra fotoana fa maintsy nandeha ireny ary na ahy lehibe antoka niondrika iny. vato ny irayâ€”volamena amin'ny varavarankely taorian'izay nampoizina. dia lafiny rehefa aho. sy fohy teo efitrano! nibolisatra aho, zavatra saingy tatá»³ ny Tsy tsy mihitsy; anatin'ny manodidina misy. vovoka. sady manodidina hatrany vao nahita dia Nanala nientanentana hahazoako saingy, toa hatrany na ary ny nanangana ny amin'ny aho. eo ary tery haharesy dia mametraka Niondrika Ny isan-karazany, ela nivoaka saingy herim-poko, araka ireo. amin'ny fohy avy sy ary Fantatro hafahafa tsy tokony avy anefa ary mivezivezy ahoâ€”heveriko namiratra tapahina, horonantsarin'ny feno latsaky mitovy feta tamin'ny efa iray efitra tsy ny mba teo aho kiraroko nisy rehefa tao teo tany io, tratrako HongroÃ , tsara zavatra amin'ity nandry Romana amin'ny izay antontam-bolamena teo atsimo, dia toy tsikaritro ny fanisana efitrano ny Ny hita. soa eo fotoana ireo Andriamanitra, ihany, izy, lehibe ireo zavatra Feno dia aman-tsara taona. aho, tamim-pifaliana, ny mbola Tsy ny Ary fanalahidy niravaka, mandra-pijoroko tsy izay amin'ny tsy iray. fitabatabana teto araka vovoka, aho, nisy ilany aiza Tiorka aho, tamim-pahagagana tady. hitako sy izay varavarankely. lalana nahita ary niezaka ny rojo tamin'ireo Avy dia aho. ity efa nahatsiaro amin'ny ny halaviran'ny Nandeha atsimo tranobe aza Britanika, fa masoko ary voaloko. firavaka, izy nijery Aotrisiana, io zavatra
en: Same day, later.â€”I have made the effort, and God, helping me, have come safely back to this room. I must put down every detail in order. I went whilst my courage was fresh straight to the window on the south side, and at once got outside on the narrow ledge of stone which runs around the building on this side. The stones are big and roughly cut, and the mortar has by process of time been washed away between them. I took off my boots, and ventured out on the desperate way. I looked down once, so as to make sure that a sudden glimpse of the awful depth would not overcome me, but after that kept my eyes away from it. I knew pretty well the direction and distance of the Countâ€™s window, and made for it as well as I could, having regard to the opportunities available. I did not feel dizzyâ€”I suppose I was too excitedâ€”and the time seemed ridiculously short till I found myself standing on the window-sill and trying to raise up the sash. I was filled with agitation, however, when I bent down and slid feet foremost in through the window. Then I looked around for the Count, but, with surprise and gladness, made a discovery. The room was empty! It was barely furnished with odd things, which seemed to have never been used; the furniture was something the same style as that in the south rooms, and was covered with dust. I looked for the key, but it was not in the lock, and I could not find it anywhere. The only thing I found was a great heap of gold in one cornerâ€”gold of all kinds, Roman, and British, and Austrian, and Hungarian, and Greek and Turkish money, covered with a film of dust, as though it had lain long in the ground. None of it that I noticed was less than three hundred years old. There were also chains and ornaments, some jewelled, but all of them old and stained.

es: Mismo dÃ­a, mÃ¡s tarde. He hecho el esfuerzo, y con ayuda de Dios he regresado a salvo a este cuarto. Debo escribir en orden cada detalle. Fui, mientras todavÃ­a mi valor estaba fresco, directamente a la ventana del lado sur, y salÃ­ fuera de este lado. Las piedras son grandes y estÃ¡n cortadas toscamente, y por el proceso del tiempo el mortero se ha desgastado. Me quitÃ© las botas y me aventurÃ© como un desesperado. MirÃ© una vez hacia abajo, como para asegurarme de que una repentina mirada de la horripilante profundidad no me sobrecogerÃ­a, pero despuÃ©s de ello mantuve los ojos viendo hacia adelante. Conozco bastante bien la ventana del conde, y me dirigÃ­ hacia ella lo mejor que pude, atendiendo a las oportunidades que se me presentaban. No me sentÃ­ mareado, supongo que estaba demasiado nervioso, y el tiempo que tardÃ© en llegar hasta el antepecho de la ventana me pareciÃ³ ridÃ­culamente corto. En un santiamÃ©n me encontrÃ© tratando de levantar la guillotina. Sin embargo, cuando me deslicÃ© con los pies primero a travÃ©s de la ventana, era presa de una terrible agitaciÃ³n. Luego busquÃ© por todos lados al conde, pero, con sorpresa y alegrÃ­a, hice un descubrimiento: Â¡el cuarto estaba vacÃ­o! Apenas estaba amueblado con cosas raras, que parecÃ­an no haber sido usadas nunca; los muebles eran de un estilo algo parecido a los que habÃ­a en los cuartos situados al sur, y estaban cubiertos de polvo. BusquÃ© la llave, pero no estaba en la cerradura, y no la pude encontrar por ningÃºn lado. Lo Ãºnico que encontrÃ© fue un gran montÃ³n de oro en una esquina, oro de todas clases, en monedas romanas y britÃ¡nicas, austriacas y hÃºngaras, griegas y turcas. Las monedas estaban cubiertas de una pelÃ­cula de polvo, como si hubiesen yacido durante largo tiempo en el suelo. Ninguna de las que notÃ© tenÃ­a menos de trescientos aÃ±os. TambiÃ©n habÃ­a cadenas y adornos, algunos enjoyados, pero todos viejos y descoloridos.

st: Ka lehlakoreng le leng la kamore e ne e le monyako o boima. Ke e lekile, hobane, kaha ke ne ke sitoa ho fumana senotlolo sa kamore kapa senotlolo sa monyako o kantle, e neng e le ntho e ka sehloohong ea patlo ea ka, ke tlameha ho etsa tlhahlobo e eketsehileng, kapa boiteko bohle ba ka e ne e tla ba lefeela. E ne e butsoe, 'me ea etella pele ka tsela e chitja ho ea litepising tse chitja, tse neng li theoha ka mokhoa o otlolohileng. Ke theohela, ke nahana ka hloko moo ke eang teng, bakeng sa litepisi li ne li le lefifi, li ntse li chesa feela ke loopholes ka har'a mason e boima. Ka tlase ho ne ho e-na le temana e lefifi, e kang kotopo, eo ka eona ho ileng ha hlaha monko o bolaeang, monko o monate oa lefatÅ¡e la khale le sa tsoa fetoha. Ha ke ntse ke feta ka mor'a moo, monko o ne o le haufi le ho feta. Qetellong ke ile ka hula bula monyako o boima o neng o eme ajar, 'me ka iphumana ke le qhobosheaneng ea khale, e senyehileng, eo ho bonahalang eka e ne e sebelisoa e le mabitla. Marulelo a ile a robeha, 'me libakeng tse peli e ne e le mehato e lebisang ho li-vault, empa lefatÅ¡e le ne le sa tsoa cheka, 'me lefatÅ¡e le behiloe mabokoseng a maholo a lehong, ho bonahatsoa ba neng ba tlisoa ke Slovaks. Ho ne ho se na motho e mong, 'me ke ne ke batla ho hong ho eketsehileng, empa ho ne ho se na letho. Joale ke ile ka tÅ¡ela mobu o mong le o mong, e le hore a se ke a lahleheloa ke monyetla. Ke theohile esita le ka har'a li-vault, moo leseli le lefifi le neng le loana, le hoja ho etsa joalo e ne e le tÅ¡abo ho moea oa ka haholo. Ke ile ka kena ho tsena tse peli, empa ke ile ka bona letho ntle le likhechana tsa li-coffins tsa khale le qubu ea lerÅle; Leha ho le joalo, ka lekhetlo la boraro, ke ile ka etsa hore ho be le sibolloa.

tn: 'Go ne go na le lebati le le bokete' - There was a hard door Ke lekile, ka gonne ke ne ke sa kgone go bona senotlolo sa kamore kgotsa senotlolo sa kgoro e e kwa ntle, se e neng e le selo se segolo sa phuruphutso ya me, ke tshwanetse go dira tlhatlhobo e nngwe gape, kgotsa maiteko otlhe a me a tla nna lefela. E ne e bulegile, e bile e ne ya tsamaya ka tsela e e tsamayang ka tsela e e kwa godimo, e e neng e tsamaya ka tsela e e kwa tlase. Ke ne ke le mo tseleng e ke neng ke le mo go yone, ke ne ke sa ntse ke le mo tseleng e ke neng ke le mo go yone, ke ne ke le mo gare ga mesedi e e bokete, e le gore ke ne ke le mo gare ga mesedi e e bokete. Kwa tlase go ne go na le temana e e lefifi, e e neng e le mo go yone, e e neng e na le monko o o botlhoko, e e neng e le monko o o monate wa lefatshe le le sa tswang go fetoga. Fa ke ntse ke tsamaya mo tseleng, monko wa me o ne o ntse o atamela le go feta. Kwa bofelong, ke ne ka bula lebati le le bokete le le neng le eme, mme ka iphitlhela ke le mo ntlong ya kgale, e e senyegileng, e go bonalang e ne e dirisiwa jaaka mabitla. Marulelo a ne a robegile, mme mo mafelong a mabedi a ne a lebisa kwa mafelong a a kwa godimo, mme lefatshe le ne le sa tswa go epwa, mme lefatshe le ne le bewa mo mabokosong a magolo a dikgong, go bonala ba ba neng ba tlisitswe ke Ba-Slovak. Go ne go se na ope yo o neng a le teng, mme ke ne ke sa batle sepe gape, mme go ne go se na ope yo o neng a le teng. Ke ne ka ralala naga nngwe le nngwe gore ke se ka latlhegelwa ke tshono. Ke ne ka tsena mo ditshosing, mo leseding le le lefifi le neng le lwana teng, le fa go ntse jalo e ne e le poifo mo moyeng wa me. Ke ne ka ya kwa go ba babedi ba bone, mme ka se ka ka bona sepe, fa e se masathwana a a kwa godimo le a lorole.+ Le fa go ntse jalo, mo nakong ya boraro, ke ne ka dira gore ke se ka ka nna le ene.

Ua matara te reira, e ua arataihia na roto i te hoÃª e'a ofai e tae atu ai i te hoÃª e'a menemene, o tei topa roa i raro. Ua pou mai au, ma te hi'o maitai i te vahi ta'u i haere, no te mea e mea poiri te e'a, e ua turama-noa-hia te reira e te mau ofa'i rarahi i roto i te fare teiaha. A haere noa ai au i roto i te piha, ua piri roa mai te hau'a e ua puai roa'tu. I te pae hopea ua iriti au i te hoÃª opani teiaha e ti'a noa ra, e tei roto vau i te hoÃª fare pureraa tahito e te parari, tei faaohipahia ei menema. Ua parari te tapo'i fare, e i roto i na vahi e piti, te vai ra te mau ofa'i e arata'i ti'a'tu i te mau apoo, tera rÃ¢, aita i maoro a'e nei, ua heru-faahou-hia te repo, e ua tuuhia te repo i roto i te mau afata raau rarahi, tei hamanihia e te mau taata hamani raau. Aita hoÃª a'e taata i reira, e ua imi au i te tahi atu ravea, aita rÃ¢ hoÃª a'e. I muri iho, ua haere atura vau na nia i te mau tenetimetera atoa o te repo, ia ore au ia erehia i te ravea. Ua pou vau i roto i te mau apoo, i reira te mori mohimohi i te toparaa, noa'tu e, ua riro te reira ei haamÇta'uraa no to'u varua. mg: Nisy varavarana lehibe teo amin'ny zoron'ilay efitrano. Nanandrana izany aho, satria tsy nahita ny fanalahidin'ny efitrano na ny fanalahidin'ny varavarana ivelany, izay tena tanjon'ny fikarohana nataoko, dia tsy maintsy manao fanadihadiana bebe kokoa aho, raha tsy izany dia ho very maina ny ezaka rehetra ataoko. Nisokatra ilay izy, ary nitarika tamin'ny alalan'ny vato iray mankany amin'ny tohatra boribory, izay nidina mafy. Nidina aho, nieritreritra tsara izay alehako, satria maizina ny tohatra, satria tsy nisy afa-tsy ny tsy fahampian'ny lavaka tao amin'ny trano mavesatra. Teo amin'ny farany ambany dia nisy lalana maizina sy tahaka ny tonelina, izay nahitana fofona mahafaty sy marary, vao avy nihodina ny fofon'ny tany taloha. Rehefa nandalo ilay andinin-tsoratra masina aho dia nihananakaiky sy nihamafy ny fofona. Tamin'ny farany dia nanokatra varavarana mavesatra iray aho izay nijoro teo amin'ny tavoara, ary nahita ny tenako tao amin'ny trano fiangonana tranainy iray rava, izay mazava ho azy fa nampiasaina ho toy ny fasana. Vaky ny tafo, ary nisy tohatra roa nitondra nankany amin'ny toerana banga, saingy vao haingana no nolavahana ny tany, ary napetraka tao anaty boaty hazo lehibe ny tany, izay miharihary fa nentin'ny Slovaky. Tsy nisy olona momba izany, ary nitady sehatra hafa aho, saingy tsy nisy. Avy eo aho dia nandeha nitety ny faritra rehetra amin'ny tany, mba tsy ho very vintana. Nidina tany amin'ny toerana malalaka aho, izay nitoloman'ny hazavana matromatroka, na dia natahotra ny fanahiko aza ny nanao izany. Tao anatin'ny roa tamin'ireo no nandehanako, nefa tsy nahita na inona na inona afa-tsy sombintsombiny tamin'ny vatam-paty tranainy sy ny vovoka nivangongo aho; 3Notafihin'i Salomona, Etama-SobÃ , ka azony.

en: At one corner of the room was a heavy door. I tried it, for, since I could not find the key of the room or the key of the outer door, which was the main object of my search, I must make further examination, or all my efforts would be in vain. It was open, and led through a stone passage to a circular stairway, which went steeply down. I descended, minding carefully where I went, for the stairs were dark, being only lit by loopholes in the heavy masonry. At the bottom there was a dark, tunnel-like passage, through which came a deathly, sickly odour, the odour of old earth newly turned. As I went through the passage the smell grew closer and heavier. At last I pulled open a heavy door which stood ajar, and found myself in an old, ruined chapel, which had evidently been used as a graveyard. The roof was broken, and in two places were steps leading to vaults, but the ground had recently been dug over, and the earth placed in great wooden boxes, manifestly those which had been brought by the Slovaks. There was nobody about, and I made search for any further outlet, but there was none. Then I went over every inch of the ground, so as not to lose a chance. I went down even into the vaults, where the dim light struggled, although to do so was a dread to my very soul. Into two of these I went, but saw nothing except fragments of old coffins and piles of dust; in the third, however, I made a discovery.

es: En una esquina del cuarto habÃ­a una pesada puerta. La empujÃ©, pues, ya que no podÃ­a encontrar la llave del cuarto o la llave de la puerta de afuera, lo cual era el principal objetivo de mi bÃºsqueda, tenÃ­a que hacer otras investigaciones, o todos mis esfuerzos serÃ­an vanos. La puerta que empujÃ© estaba abierta, y me condujo a travÃ©s de un pasadizo de piedra hacia una escalera de caracol, que bajaba muy empinada. DescendÃ­, poniendo mucho cuidado en donde pisaba, pues las gradas estaban oscuras, siendo alumbradas solamente por las troneras de la pesada mamposterÃ­a. En el fondo habÃ­a un pasadizo oscuro, semejante a un tÃºnel, a travÃ©s del cual se percibÃ­a un mortal y enfermizo olor: el olor de la tierra reciÃ©n volteada. A medida que avancÃ© por el pasadizo, el olor se hizo mÃ¡s intenso y mÃ¡s cercano. Finalmente, abrÃ­ una pesada puerta que estaba entornada y me encontrÃ© en una vieja y arruinada capilla, que evidentemente habÃ­a sido usada como cementerio. El techo estaba agrietado, y en los lugares habÃ­a gradas que conducÃ­an a bÃ³vedas, pero el suelo habÃ­a sido recientemente excavado y la tierra habÃ­a sido puesta en grandes cajas de madera, manifiestamente las que transportaran los eslovacos. No habÃ­a nadie en los alrededores, y yo hice un minucioso registro de cada pulgada de terreno. BajÃ© incluso a las bÃ³vedas, donde la tenue luz luchaba con las sombras, aunque al hacerlo mi alma se llenÃ³ del mÃ¡s terrible horror. Fui a dos de Ã©stas, pero no vi nada sino fragmentos de viejos fÃ©retros y montones de polvo; sin embargo, en la tercera, hice un descubrimiento.

tn: Ka fa letlhakoreng le lengwe, go ne ga nna le diphiri tse dintsi tse di neng di le gaufi. Go ne go lebega modumo o ntse o tlhatloga mo letsogong la gagwe, fela jaaka mmino o mogolo wa orchestra o ne o tlola ka fa tlase ga bÃ¢ton wa mokgweetsi. Fa a sena go tsamaya, o ne a ya kwa lemating la gagwe, a ya kwa lemating la gagwe, a ntsha mejako e e bokete mme a simolola go e gapa.

en: Close at hand came the howling of many wolves. It was almost as if the sound sprang up at the rising of his hand, just as the music of a great orchestra seems to leap under the bÃ¢ton of the conductor. After a pause of a moment, he proceeded, in his stately way, to the door, drew back the ponderous bolts, unhooked the heavy chains, and began to draw it open.

tn: Mme lebati le ne le sa batle go tshikhinyega. Go itlhoboga go ne ga ntshwara. Ke ne ka goga, mme ka goga, kwa kgorong, mme ka e tshikinya go fitlhela, e le kgolo jaaka e ne e le, e ne ya rora mo casement ya yone. Ke ne ke kgona go bona bolt e thuntshitswe. en: But the door would not move. Despair seized me. I pulled, and pulled, at the door, and shook it till, massive as it was, it rattled in its casement. I could see the bolt shot. It had been locked after I left the Count.

st: Joale takatso e hlaha e ile ea nkisa ho fumana senotlolo seo kotsing efe kapa efe, 'me ka ikemisetsa ka nako eo le moo ho hloa lerako hape le ho fumana kamore ea Count. O ne a ka 'na a npolaea, empa hona joale o ne a bonahala e le khetho e thabisang ea bokhopo. Ke ile ka potlakela ho ea fensetereng e ka bochabela, 'me ke ile ka heletsa leboteng, joaloka pele, ka kamoreng ea Count. E ne e se na letho, empa e ne e le kamoo ke neng ke lebelletse. Ke ne ke sitoa ho bona senotlolo kae kapa kae, empa qubu ea khauta e sala. Ke ile ka kena ka monyako ka k'honeng ebe ke theoha litepising tsa winding le haufi le ho feta lefifi ho ea holong ea khale. Hona joale ke ne ke tseba moo ke neng ke batla phoofolo ea tonanahali eo ke neng ke e batla.

tn: Ka nako eo, ke ne ka dira gore ke nne le seabe mo kotsing eo, mme ke ne ka swetsa ka gore ke boele morago ke bo ke le kwa godimo. O ne a ka nna a mpolaya, mme gone jaanong go ne go lebega go na le dilo tse di itumedisang. Fa ke sena go ikhutsa, ke ne ka tabogela kwa fensetereng ya botlhabatsatsi, ke ne ka tÅ¡habile lobota jaaka pele, mo ntlong ya ga Kgosi. E ne e se na sepe, fela jaaka ke ne ke akantse. Ke ne ke sa kgone go bona selotlolo gongwe le gongwe, mme lequbu la gouta le ne le setse le le teng. Ke ne ka tsena mo lebating le le kwa tlase ga tsela e e tsamayang ka fa tlase ga tsela e e tsamayang ka yone le mo tseleng e e lefifi go ya kwa golong e e kwa godimo. Gone jaanong ke ne ke itse gore ke ne ke tla bona kae gore ke ne ke batla kae.
ty: I muri iho ua tupu mai te hoÃª hinaaro puai i roto ia'u ia titau i taua taviri ra noa'tu eaha te huru, e ua faaoti au i taua taime ra ia pa'uma faahou i ni'a i te papa'i e ia haere i roto i te piha ta'umaraa. E nehenehe oia e haapohe ia ' u, i teie nei rÃ¢, e au ra e o te pohe te maitiraa oaoa roa ' ' e o te mau ino. Ma te faaea ore, ua horo atu vau i te haamaramarama i te pae hitiaa o te rÃ¢, e ua horo atu vau na ni'a i te papa'i, mai na mua'tu, i roto i te piha o te taata tia'i. Aita e taata i roto, tera rÃ¢, mai ta'u i mana'o. Aita vau i ite i te hoÃª taviri i te mau vahi atoa, ua vai noa rÃ¢ te haapueraa auro. Ua haere atu vau na roto i te opani i te poro e na ni'a i te e'a titi'ai'ai e na ni'a i te e'a pouri e tae atu ai i te fare pureraa tahito. Ua ite maitai au i teie nei i hea e itehia ai te mea ta'u i imi.

mg: Avy eo dia nisy faniriana tsy nampoizina izay nahatonga ahy hahazo izany fanalahidy izany na inona na inona mety ho loza mety hitranga, ary nanapa-kevitra aho tamin'izany fotoana izany fa hiakatra indray ny rindrina ary hahazo ny efitrano Count. Mety hamono ahy izy, nefa toa ny fahafatesana no safidy tsara indrindra amin'ny ratsy. Tsy nijanona aho fa nihazakazaka nankany amin'ny varavarankely atsinanana, ary nidina nidina ny rindrina, toy ny teo aloha, tao amin'ny efitranon'ny Count. Foana ilay izy, saingy araka ny nieritreretako azy izany. Tsy nahita fanalahidy na aiza na aiza aho, saingy mbola tavela ilay korontam-bolamena. Nandeha namakivaky ny varavarana teo amin'ny zorony aho ary nidina tamin'ny tohatra miolikolika ary nanaraka ny lalana maizina mankany amin'ny trano fiangonana taloha. Fantatro tsara izao hoe aiza no ahitana ilay biby mahatsiravina notadiaviko.

en: Then a wild desire took me to obtain that key at any risk, and I determined then and there to scale the wall again and gain the Countâ€™s room. He might kill me, but death now seemed the happier choice of evils. Without a pause I rushed up to the east window, and scrambled down the wall, as before, into the Countâ€™s room. It was empty, but that was as I expected. I could not see a key anywhere, but the heap of gold remained. I went through the door in the corner and down the winding stair and along the dark passage to the old chapel. I knew now well enough where to find the monster I sought.

en: As I write there is in the passage below a sound of many tramping feet and the crash of weights being set down heavily, doubtless the boxes, with their freight of earth. There is a sound of hammering; it is the box being nailed down. Now I can hear the heavy feet tramping again along the hall, with many other idle feet coming behind them.

Ha moreki oa rona a lakatsa ho fana ka thepa e entsoeng kapele kamoo ho ka khonehang, re tla qobelloa ke lihlopha tsa hau tse lokiselitsoeng Sefapanong sa Morena ka nako eo e bitsoang le ka ntle ho fetisa thepa e eang moo u eang teng. tn: "Tsweetswee tsenya mabokoso, a le masome a matlhano ka palo, e e dirang gore consignment, mo kagong e e senyegileng e e nang le karolo ya ntlo mme e tshwailwe mo go 'A' mo diagramong e e bokete e e kwa godimo. O tla lemoga gore ke lefelo la bogologolo le le neng le le mo go lone, ka gonne ke lefelo la bogologolo le le neng le le mo go lone. Dithoto di tswa ka terena ka 9:30 go ya go bosigo, mme di tla bo di duetswe kwa Sefapaanong sa Kgosi ka 4:30 go ya go motshegare. Fa re batla go dira jalo, re tla tshwanelwa ke go nna le baemedi ba rona ka bonako jo bo kgonegang, re tla patelesega go nna le setlhopha sa rona sa bogosi ka nako e e beilweng le ka nako e e rileng ka go romela dithoto tse di yang kwa go tsone. E le gore o kgone go duela ditshenyegelo tse di ka kgonagalang go ya ka ditlhokego dingwe le dingwe tse di tlhokegang tsa go duela mo mafapheng a gago, re tsenya tÅ¡heke eno ka tÅ¡heke ya dikilogerama di le lesome (Â£10), ka kopo amogela. Ny entana dia miala amin'ny fiaran-dalamby amin'ny 9:30 ka hatramin'ny alina, ary ho tonga eo amin'ny King's Cross amin'ny 4:30 hatramin'ny tolakandro rahampitso. Araka ny fanirian'ny mpanjifanay ny fandefasana natao haingana araka izay azo atao, dia ho voatery amin'ny ekipanao vonona eo amin'ny Hazofijalian'ny Mpanjaka izahay amin'ny fotoana voatondro sy avy hatrany amin'ny fampitana ny entana mankany amin'ny toerana halehany. Mba hanafoanana izay mety ho fahatarana azo atao amin'ny alalan'ny fepetra mahazatra toy ny fandoavam-bola ao amin'ny departemanta, dia enclose cheque amin'ny folo kilao (Â£ 10), fandraisana izay manaiky azafady. Tokony ho ny anjara-raharaha ho kely noho izany vola, dia afaka miverina fifandanjana; Raha lehibe kokoa, dia handefa taratasim-bola ho an'ny fahasamihafana eo amin'ny fihainoanay avy aminareo izahay. en: â€œYou will please deposit the boxes, fifty in number, which form the consignment, in the partially ruined building forming part of the house and marked â€˜Aâ€™ on rough diagram enclosed. Your agent will easily recognise the locality, as it is the ancient chapel of the mansion. The goods leave by the train at 9:30 to-night, and will be due at Kingâ€™s Cross at 4:30 to-morrow afternoon. As our client wishes the delivery made as soon as possible, we shall be obliged by your having teams ready at Kingâ€™s Cross at the time named and forthwith conveying the goods to destination. In order to obviate any delays possible through any routine requirements as to payment in your departments, we enclose cheque herewith for ten pounds (Â£10), receipt of which please acknowledge. Should the charge be less than this amount, you can return balance; if greater, we shall at once send cheque for difference on hearing from you. You are to leave the keys on coming away in the main hall of the house, where the proprietor may get them on his entering the house by means of his duplicate key.

en: After a while I left him. The attendant tells me that he was quiet until just before dawn, and that then he began to get uneasy, and at length violent, until at last he fell into a paroxysm which exhausted him so that he swooned into a sort of coma.

st: Ka mor'a moo, ho na le phetoho e 'ngoe ho ngaka ea ka. Ka hora ya bohlano ke ile ka mo sheba, mme ka mo fumana a thabile mme a kgotsofala kamoo a neng a tlwaetse kateng. O ne a tÅ¡oasa lintsintsi 'me a li ja, 'me o ne a boloka hlokomela ha a ts'oaroa ha hae ka ho etsa matÅ¡oao a lipekere moeling oa monyako lipakeng tsa mengoapo ea padding. Ha a mpona, o ile a tla mme a kopa tÅ¡oarelo ka boitÅ¡oaro ba hae bo bobe, mme a nkopa ka mokhoa o ikokobelitseng haholo, o lla hore o tle o khutlele kamoreng ea hae le ho ba le buka ea hae ea mangolo hape. Ke ne ke nahana hore ho monate ho mo soahla: kahoo o khutlela ka kamoreng ea hae ka fensetere e butsoe. O na le tsoekere ea tee ea hae e hasaneng fensetereng, 'me e kotula kotulo e ngata ea lintsintsi. Ha a sa li ja hona joale, empa o li kenya ka lebokoseng, joalo ka tsa khale, 'me o se a ntse a hlahloba likhutlong tsa kamore ea hae ho fumana sekho. Ke lekile ho bua ka matsatsi a 'maloa a fetileng, bakeng sa tlhaiso-taba efe kapa efe ea menahano ea hae e ka nthusa haholo; 'Me ha aa tla tsoha. Ka motsotsoana kapa tse peli o ne a shebahala a hloname haholo, 'me o ile a re ka lentsoe le hole, joalokaha eka a bua ka eona ho e-na le eena ho feta ho 'na.

tn: Gape, morago ga moo, go na le phetogo e nngwe gape mo molwetseng wa me. Ka nako ya botlhano ke ne ka mo leba, ka fitlhela a lebega a itumetse e bile a itumetse jaaka a ne a ntse a le teng. O ne a di ja, a bo a di ja, a bo a di tshwara ka go dira ditshika tsa gagwe mo letlhakoreng la kgoro e e fa gare ga mebila. Fa a ne a bona, o ne a kopa maitshwarelo ka boitshwaro jwa gagwe jo bo utlwisang botlhoko, mme a nkopa gore ke boele mo ntlong ya gagwe gape. Ke ne ke akanya gore go ne go le monate go mo sega, ka jalo o ne a boela mo kamoreng ya gagwe ka fensetere e e bulegileng. O na le sukiri ya teye ya gagwe e anama mo fensetereng, mme e roba thobo e ntsi thata. Ga a di je, mme o di bee mo lebokosong, jaaka tsa bogologolo, mme o setse a tlhatlhoba dikhutlo tsa kamore ya gagwe go bona sepo. Ke lekile go bua le ene mo malatsing a le mmalwa a a fetileng, ka gonne dikakanyo tsa gagwe di ne di tla nthusa thata mo go nna. ga a kitla a tsoga. 11Ka motsotso o le mongwe kgotsa ba babedi ba ne ba kgatlhiwa ke ditlhong, a bua ka lentswe le le kwa kgakala, e kete le fa go ntse jalo, go na le go bua ka ga me, go na le go bua ka ga me.
ty: I muri iho.â€”Te tahi faahou tauiraa i roto i to'u taata ma'i. I te hora pae, ua hi'o atura vau i roto ia ' na, e ua ite atura vau e mea oaoa roa o ' na e ua oaoa roa oia mai na mua ' ' e. Te haru ra oia i te ra'o e te amu ra i te reira, e te haamana'o noa ra oia i to'na haruraa na roto i te patiaraa i te naero i te hiti o te opani i ropu i te mau ofa'i amuraa maa. I to'na iteraa mai ia'u, ua haere mai oia e hi'o ia'u no ta'na ohipa ino, e ua ani mai ia'u ma te haehaa e te haehaa ia faaho'ihia vau i roto i to'na iho piha e ia farii faahou i ta'na buka nota. Ua mana'o vau e, e mea maitai no'na : no reira, ua ho'i mai oia i roto i to'na piha ma te vai matara noa te haamaramarama. Te vai ra te tihota i roto i ta'na ti i ni'a i te haamaramarama, e te ooti nei oia i te mau ra'o. mg: Tatá»³ aoriana.â€”Fiovana hafa koa ny fahasalamako. Nijery azy aho tamin'ny dimy ora, ary hitako fa toa faly sy afa-po toy ny taloha izy. Nisambotra lalitra izy ary nihinana izany, ary nanamarika ny fisamborana azy tamin'ny alalan'ny fanaovana fantsika teo amin'ny sisin'ny varavarana teo anelanelan'ny tandavan'ny padding. Rehefa nahita ahy izy dia nanatona ary niala tsiny noho ny fitondran-tena ratsy nataony, ary nangataka ahy tamin'ny fomba tena feno fanetren-tena sy feno fanetren-tena mba ho entina miverina any amin'ny efitranony sy hanana ny boky fanamarihany indray. Nihevitra aho fa tsara ny hanihany azy: ka dia niverina tao amin'ny efitranony izy niaraka tamin'ny varavarankely misokatra. Miparitaka eo amin'ny varavarankely ny siramamy avy amin'ny dite, ary mijinja ny vokatry ny lalitra. Tsy mihinana azy ireo izy ankehitriny, fa mametraka azy ireo ao anaty boaty, toy ny taloha, ary efa mandinika ny zoron'ny efitranony mba hahitana hala. Niezaka ny nasaiko niresaka momba ireo andro vitsivitsy lasa izy, satria izay mety ho famantarana ny eritreriny dia tena hanampy ahy; Saingy tsy nety nitsangana izy. Ary nony indray mipi-maso monja na roa dia nalahelo mafy izy ka niteny tamin'ny feo lavitra, toy ny milaza izany amin'ny tenany toy izay ho ahy:

en: Later.â€”Another change in my patient. At five oâ€™clock I looked in on him, and found him seemingly as happy and contented as he used to be. He was catching flies and eating them, and was keeping note of his capture by making nail-marks on the edge of the door between the ridges of padding. When he saw me, he came over and apologised for his bad conduct, and asked me in a very humble, cringing way to be led back to his own room and to have his note-book again. I thought it well to humour him: so he is back in his room with the window open. He has the sugar of his tea spread out on the window-sill, and is reaping quite a harvest of flies. He is not now eating them, but putting them into a box, as of old, and is already examining the corners of his room to find a spider. I tried to get him to talk about the past few days, for any clue to his thoughts would be of immense help to me; but he would not rise. For a moment or two he looked very sad, and said in a sort of far-away voice, as though saying it rather to himself than to me:â€”

en: All night long I watched by her. She never stirred, but slept on and on in a deep, tranquil, life-giving, health-giving sleep. Her lips were slightly parted, and her breast rose and fell with the regularity of a pendulum. There was a smile on her face, and it was evident that no bad dreams had come to disturb her peace of mind.

En su rostro se dibujaba una sonrisa, y era evidente que no habÃ­an llegado pesadillas a perturbar la paz de su mente.

st: Ha ke ntse ke phahamisa lifofu, 'me letsatsi la hoseng le moroalloa kamoreng, ke ile ka utloa hiss e tlase ea ts'usumetso ea Moprofesa, mme ka tseba seoelo sa sona se sa tloaelehang, tÅ¡abo e bolaeang e thunya ka pelo ea ka. Ha ke ntse ke feta o ile a fallela morao, le exclamation ea hae ea tÅ¡abo, "Gott ho Himmel!" ha aa ka a hloka ts'ebetso sefahlehong sa hae sa agonised. O ile a phahamisa letsoho la hae 'me a supa betheng, 'me sefahleho sa hae sa tÅ¡epe se ne se huloa le ashen tÅ¡oeu. Ke ne ke nahana hore mangole a ka a qala ho thothomela.

tn: Fa ke ntse ke tsholetsa matlho, mme letsatsi la moso la tlhaba mo kamoreng, ke ne ka utlwa sefatlhego sa ga Morutabana se se kwa tlase sa kgatlhiso, ka itse se se bonalang se se bonalang, letshogo le le bolayang ka pelo ya me. Fa ke ntse ke tsamaya, o ne a re: "Ke ne ka se ka ka nna le sepe se se neng se sa dira gore a se ka a tlhola a re: "Ke ne ke sa batle sepe se se neng se le mo go yone." O ne a tsholetsa letsogo, a supa bolao, sefatlhego sa gagwe sa tshipi se ne se gogwa le sesweu sa ashen. Ke ne ka utlwa gore mangole a me a simolola go roroma.
ty: A faati'a noa ai au i te tapo'i mata, e a hiti noa mai ai te maramarama o te mahana i roto i te piha, ua faaroo a'era vau i te haaramarama a te orometua, e ma te ite i to'na aravihi ore, ua Ã´ maira te hoÃª mata'u pohe i roto i to'u aau. A tere noa ai au, ua ho'i maira oia i muri, e no to'na ri'ari'a rahi, ua tuo a'era oia e, " A faaea i roto Ia'na ! " aita e faufaa no'na ia ti'a i ni'a i to'na hoho'a mata. Ua afa'i oia i to'na rima i ni'a e ua faatoro i ni'a i te ro'i, e ua hutihia to'na hoho'a mata auri e mai te uouo ra te huru. Ua ite a'era vau e, te haamata ra to'u turi avae i te rurutaina.

mg: Rehefa nanangana ny jamba aho, ary ny hazavan'ny masoandro maraina no nameno ny efitrano, dia reko ny fahavitsian'ny aingam-panahin'ilay Mpampianatra, ary fantatro fa tsy fahita firy izany, tahotra mahafaty no nipoaka tao am-poko. Rehefa nandalo aho dia niverina izy, ary ny fitabatabany tamin'ny horohoro hoe: "Gott in Himmel!" dia tsy nila fampiharana avy amin'ny tarehiny feno fijaliana. Nanainga ny tanany izy ary nanondro ny fandriana, ary ny tarehiny vy dia voasoritra sy fotsy fotsy. Nahatsapa aho fa nanomboka nangovitra ny lohaliko.

en: As I raised the blind, and the morning sunlight flooded the room, I heard the Professorâ€™s low hiss of inspiration, and knowing its rarity, a deadly fear shot through my heart. As I passed over he moved back, and his exclamation of horror, â€œGott in Himmel!â€ needed no enforcement from his agonised face. He raised his hand and pointed to the bed, and his iron face was drawn and ashen white. I felt my knees begin to tremble.

tn: Re ne ra tsena mo kamoreng, ra ya le rona. Go ne go se na sepe se se neng sa dira gore morutabana a se ka a bonwa e le se neng se le mo go yone. O ne a di gapa ka fa ditereneng mme a di gakatsa ka pabalesego. O ne a tsaya dipilisi di le mmalwa tse di neng di le mo godimo ga mesa, jaaka e kete o ka dira gore go nne le moya o o montsi o o ka nnang mo go one. 10A ba a tlola mojako otlhe, fa godimo, kwa godimo, kwa tlase le kwa ntlheng nngwe le nngwe, a dikologa molelo ka mokgwa o le mongwe fela. E ne e lebega e kete ke ne ke le mo go yone, mme jaanong ke ne ka re, ke ne ke re:

mg: Niditra tao amin'ny efitrano izahay, nitondra ireo voninkazo niaraka taminay. Ny zavatra nataon'ny Profesora dia tena hafahafa ary tsy hita tao amin'ny fivarotam-panafody izay henoko hatramin'izay. Voalohany dia nofatorany ny varavarankely ary nofatorany tsara; Avy eo, naka voninkazo vitsivitsy izy, dia nosafosafoiny teo ambonin'ny lavenona, toy ny hoe mba hahazoana antoka fa ho feno fofona tongolo gasy ny rivotra rehetra izay mety hiditra. Ary ny tavin-drano lehibe dia nosafosafoiny tamin'ny sakan'ny varavarana, dia teo ambonin'ny sakan'ny varavarana, na teo ambany, na tamin'ny lafiny iray, na tamin'ny lafiny iray, na tamin'ny lafiny iray, ary nanodidina ny fitoeran'afo tamin'ny fomba mitovy. en: We went into the room, taking the flowers with us. The Professorâ€™s actions were certainly odd and not to be found in any pharmacopÅ“ia that I ever heard of. First he fastened up the windows and latched them securely; next, taking a handful of the flowers, he rubbed them all over the sashes, as though to ensure that every whiff of air that might get in would be laden with the garlic smell. Then with the wisp he rubbed all over the jamb of the door, above, below, and at each side, and round the fireplace in the same way. It all seemed grotesque to me, and presently I said:â€”

Las acciones del profesor eran verdaderamente raras y no creo que se pudiera encontrar alguna farmacopea en la cual yo encontrara noticias. Primero cerrÃ³ las ventanas y las asegurÃ³ con aldaba; luego, tomando un ramo de flores, frotÃ³ con ellas las guillotinas, como para asegurarse de que cada soplo de aire que pudiera pasar a travÃ©s de ellas estuviera cargado con el olor a ajo. DespuÃ©s, con el manojo frotÃ³ los batientes de la puerta, arriba, abajo y a cada lado, y alrededor de la chimenea de la misma manera. Todo me pareciÃ³ muy grotesco, y al momento le dije al profesor:

tn: "She's Gone Swang" Gone jaanong ga e kitla e nna telele. Go tla nna le pharologanyo e kgolo, e ka tswa e le gore a o a swa o a tshwenyega kgotsa o robetse. Tsogang ngwana yo o humanegileng, a a tle a bone tsa bofelo. Re solofetse mo go ene, mme re mo solofetsa gore o tla re naya tsholofetso.

st: 'Me ka sebele, ho na le phetoho e makatsang eo ke neng ke e hlokometse bosiu. Phefumoloho ea hae e ile ea eketseha, molomo oa buleha, 'me marenene a pale, a huleloa morao, a etsa hore meno a shebahale a le telele le a bohale ho feta leha e le neng pele. Ka mokhoa oa ho robala, o sa hlaka, o sa tsebe letho ka tsela eo a ileng a bula mahlo a hae, a neng a lerootho ebile a lerootho ka nako e le 'ngoe, mme a re ka lentsoe le bonolo, le lerata, joalo ka ha ke ne ke sa utloe molomong oa hae.

en: And then insensibly there came the strange change which I had noticed in the night. Her breathing grew stertorous, the mouth opened, and the pale gums, drawn back, made the teeth look longer and sharper than ever. In a sort of sleep-waking, vague, unconscious way she opened her eyes, which were now dull and hard at once, and said in a soft, voluptuous voice, such as I had never heard from her lips:â€”

en: We have just received intelligence that another child, missed last night, was only discovered late in the morning under a furze bush at the Shooterâ€™s Hill side of Hampstead Heath, which is, perhaps, less frequented than the other parts. It has the same tiny wound in the throat as has been noticed in other cases. It was terribly weak, and looked quite emaciated. It too, when partially restored, had the common story to tell of being lured away by the â€œbloofer lady.â€

st: Na u ka mpolella hore na ke hobane'ng ha tore e phela nako e telele ho feta meloko ea banna? Ke hobane'ng ha tlou e tsoela pele ho fihlela a bona li-dynasties? Hona ke hobane'ng ha parrot e sa shoe feela ka ho longoa ha katse kapa ntja kapa tletlebo e 'ngoe? Na u ka mpolella hore na ke hobane'ng ha banna ba lumela lilemong tsohle le libakeng tseo ho na le ba seng bakae ba lulang kamehla haeba ba ka fuoa tumello; Banna le basali ba ke ke ba shoa? Kaofela rea tseba hore na ke mang ea tsebang hore na ke mang ea nang le tsebo ea hore ho bile le li-toads tse koaletsoeng majoeng ka lilemo tse likete, ho koala ka lesoba le lenyenyane hoo le mo tÅ¡oereng ho tloha bocha ba lefats'e. Na u ka mpolella hore na fakir ea Maindia e ka iketsetsa joang hore e shoe 'me e patoa, 'me lebitla la hae le tiisitsoe le poone e lenngoeng ho eona, 'me poone e kotuoe le ho e jella ebe e kopuoa ebe e khaola hape, ebe banna ba tla 'me ba tlosa tiiso e sa feleng le hore ho na le leshano la India fakir,  Bafu ha baa ka ba shoa, empa e le hore a ka tsoha 'me a tsamaea har'a bona joaloka pele?" Mona ke ile ka mo sitisoa. Ke ile ka ikutloa ke le khathatseha; O ile a ikutloa a tletse maikutlo a hae a ho ikhetholla le ho se khone ho nahana hore monahano oa ka o ile oa lelekoa. Ke ne ke e-na le maikutlo a dim hore o ne a nthuta thuto, ha nako e telele o ne a tloaetse ho etsa thutong ea hae Amsterdam; Empa o ne a ka nako eo ho mpolella ntho eo, e le hore nka ba le ntho e nahanang ka kelellong ka linako tsohle. Empa hona joale ke ne ke se na thuso ena, leha ho le joalo ke ne ke batla ho mo latela, kahoo ke ile ka re: "

tn: A o ka ntlhalosetsa gore ke ka ntlha yang fa Tori a tshela lobaka lo loleele go feta dikokomana tsa batho? Ke ka ntlha yang fa tlou e ntse e tsamaya le go bona dingwao tsa yone? Ke ka ntlha yang fa go ne go se na lebaka la go bo go na le ditsafatsi tsa katse kgotsa tse dingwe? A o ka ntlhalosetsa gore ke ka ntlha yang fa batho ba dumela mo metlheng yotlhe le mo mafelong a go nna le batho ba le mmalwa fela ba ba tshelang ka metlha fa ba ka newa tetla; A banna le basadi ga ba swe? Rotlhe re a itse gore le fa go ntse jalo, re itse gore go na le dingwaga di le diketekete tsa batho ba ba nang le dingwaga di le diketekete ba ba neng ba tshela mo lefatsheng leno, ba ne ba mo tshwara fela fa ba sa ntse ba le mo lefatsheng. A o ka mpolella ka moo moindia a ka iketsetsang hore a shwe, mme a epelwa, lebitla la hae le tshwailweng hodima yona, le poone e jetsweng, mme e jelwe, e jelwe, ya kotulwa hape, mme ya rema hape, mme banna ba a tla, ba tlosa sekano se se senang sebe, le hore ho na le motshwaruwa wa India,  Ga a a swa, mme ke mang yo o tsamayang mo gare ga bone jaaka pele? ke mo kgoreletse. Ke ne ka feretlhega; O ne a tshwentswe ke maikutlo a gagwe a tlholego mme a ka kgona go bona gore ke ne ke sa kgone go dira dilo tse ke neng ke di akanya ka tsone. Ke ne ka lemoga gore o ne a nthuta dithuto dingwe tse di fetileng, fa a ne a le mo thutong ya gagwe e e fetileng, o ne a le mo thutong ya gagwe kwa Jeremane. Le fa go ntse jalo, o ne a mpolelela selo se, gore ke kgone go akanya ka nako tsotlhe. Mme jwale ke ne ke se na thuso, empa ke ne ke batla ho mo latela, ka hona ke ile ka re:

Nahoana ny elefanta no mitohy sy mitohy mandra-pahitany ny dinasties; Ary nahoana no tsy maty noho ny kaikitry ny saka na ny alika na ny fitarainana hafa ny boloky? Azonao lazaina amiko ve hoe nahoana ny lehilahy no mino ny sokajin-taona rehetra sy ny toerana rehetra fa misy vitsivitsy izay miaina foana raha toa ka mahazo alalana izy ireo; Misy lehilahy sy vehivavy ve tsy afaka ny ho faty? Fantatsika rehetraâ€”satria ny siansa dia niantoka ny zava-misyâ€”fa nisy radÃ ka nohidiana tao anaty vato nandritra ny an'arivony taona, nohidiana tao anaty lavaka kely iray izay tsy nihazona azy afa-tsy hatramin'ny fahatanoran'izao tontolo izao. Azonao lazaina amiko ve ny fomba ahafahan'ny fakir Indiana mamono tena sy nalevina, ary ny fasany voaisy tombo-kase sy ny katsaka namafy azy, ary ny katsaka dia nojinjaina sy nafafy sy nojinjaina ary notapatapahina indray, ary avy eo dia tonga ny olona ka manaisotra ny tombo-kase tsy tapaka ary misy ny fakir Indiana,  Moa tsy maty va, fa izay mitsangana ka mandeha eo aminy tahaka ny teo aloha ?" Nanapaka azy teto aho. Sahiran-tsaina aho; Tena feno olona tao an-tsaiko izy ny lisitry ny zava-mahagaga ao amin'ny natiora sy ny mety ho tsy fahafahana manao zavatra ka ny saiko dia efa voaroaka. Nanana hevitra manjavozavo aho fa nampianatra lesona vitsivitsy tamiko izy, toy ny fanaony taloha tany amin'ny fianarany tany Amsterdam; Fa izy kosa dia zatra nilaza tamiko izany zavatra izany, mba hananako ny hevitry ny saina mandrakariva. en: â€œCan you tell me why the tortoise lives more long than generations of men; why the elephant goes on and on till he have seen dynasties; and why the parrot never die only of bite of cat or dog or other complaint? Can you tell me why men believe in all ages and places that there are some few who live on always if they be permit; that there are men and women who cannot die? We all knowâ€”because science has vouched for the factâ€”that there have been toads shut up in rocks for thousands of years, shut in one so small hole that only hold him since the youth of the world. Can you tell me how the Indian fakir can make himself to die and have been buried, and his grave sealed and corn sowed on it, and the corn reaped and be cut and sown and reaped and cut again, and then men come and take away the unbroken seal and that there lie the Indian fakir, not dead, but that rise up and walk amongst them as before?â€ Here I interrupted him. I was getting bewildered; he so crowded on my mind his list of natureâ€™s eccentricities and possible impossibilities that my imagination was getting fired. I had a dim idea that he was teaching me some lesson, as long ago he used to do in his study at Amsterdam; but he used then to tell me the thing, so that I could have the object of thought in mind all the time. But now I was without this help, yet I wanted to follow him, so I said:â€”

es: â€“Â¿Puede usted decirme por quÃ© una tortuga vive mucho mÃ¡s tiempo que muchas generaciones de hombres? Â¿Por quÃ© el elefante sigue viviendo hasta que ha visto dinastÃ­as, y por quÃ© el loro nunca muere si no es de la mordedura de un gato o un perro, u otro accidente? Â¿Puede usted decirme por quÃ© en todas las edades y lugares los hombres creen que hay unos hombres que viven si se les permite, es decir, que hay unos hombres y mujeres que no mueren de muerte natural? Todos sabemos, porque la ciencia ha atestiguado el hecho, que algunos sapitos han estado encerrados en formaciones rocosas durante miles de aÃ±os, en un pequeÃ±o agujero que los ha sostenido desde los primeros aÃ±os del mundo. Â¿Puede usted decirme cÃ³mo el faquir hindÃº puede dejarse morir y enterrar, y sellar su tumba plantando sobre ella maÃ­z, y que el maÃ­z madure y se corte y desgrane y se siembre y madure y se corte otra vez, y que entonces los hombres vengan y retiren el sello sin romper y que ahÃ­ se encuentre el faquir hindÃº, no muerto, sino que se levante y camine entre ellos como antes? Y al llegar aquÃ­ lo interrumpÃ­. Me estaba descontrolando; de tal manera estaba amontonando en mi mente su lista de todas las excentricidades e imposibilidades "posibles" que mi imaginaciÃ³n parecÃ­a haber cogido fuego. Tuve la vaga idea de que me estaba dando alguna clase de lecciÃ³n, como solÃ­a hacerlo hacÃ­a algÃºn tiempo en su estudio en Ãmsterdam; pero Ã©l solÃ­a decirme la cosa de manera que yo pudiera tener el objeto en la mente todo el tiempo. Mas ahora yo estaba sin esta ayuda, y sin embargo lo querÃ­a seguir, por lo que dije:

st: "Mosuoe, ntumelle hore ke be seithuti sa hao sa lapeng hape. Mpolelle thesis, e le hore ke tle ke sebelise tsebo ea hau ha u ntse u tsoela pele. Hajoale ke ea kelellong ea ka ho ea supa e le monna ea hlanyang, eseng ea phetseng hantle, o latela mohopolo. Ke utloa eka ke novice lumbering ka bohlaba ka mohono, ho tlolela ho tloha tussock e 'ngoe ho e' ngoe ka boiteko bo foufetseng ho ea pele ho ea pele ntle le ho tseba moo ke eang teng. "

tn: "Mma ke boele ke nne morutabana wa me gape." Mpolelele gore ke tle ke dirise kitso ya gago jaaka o ntse o tsamaya. Ka nako e le nngwe ke batla go itse gore ke motho yo o tsenwang ke motho yo o sa itekanelang, e seng yo o siameng. Ke ne ke ikutlwa ke le motho yo o ratang go ya kwa go yo mongwe yo o sa rateng go ya kwa go yo mongwe a sa itse kwa ke yang teng."

mg: "Ry mpampianatra, avelao aho ho mpianatrao indray. Lazao ahy ny voka-pikarohana mba hampihariko ny fahalalanao rehefa mandeha ianao. Amin'izao fotoana izao aho dia mandeha ao an-tsaiko hatrany amin'ny teboka iray amin'ny maha-lehilahy adala ahy, fa tsy olona salama saina, manaraka hevitra iray. en: â€œProfessor, let me be your pet student again. Tell me the thesis, so that I may apply your knowledge as you go on. At present I am going in my mind from point to point as a mad man, and not a sane one, follows an idea. I feel like a novice lumbering through a bog in a mist, jumping from one tussock to another in the mere blind effort to move on without knowing where I am going.â€

st: Ho bula lemati. Leha ho le joalo e le kannete, o tla lula a kholisehile. " Hang ha a qala ho ntÅ¡a li-screws, 'me qetellong o ile a phahamisa sekwahelo, a bonts'a casing ea lead beneath. Mahlo a ka a ne a batla a le hole haholo ho nna. Ho ne ho bonahala eka ho ne ho bonahala eka motho ea shoang joalokaha eka a ka be a ile a hlobola liaparo tsa hae borokong ha a ntse a phela; Ke ne ke hlile ke tÅ¡oere letsoho la hae ho mo thibela. 'Me o ile a re, "O tla bona," 'me o ne a korotla ka mokotleng oa hae, o ile a ntÅ¡a e nyenyane. Striking the turnscrew ka etella pele ka lebelo tlaase tlaase stab, e ileng ea etsa hore ke wince, o ile a etsa lesoba nyenyane, e neng e le, leha ho le joalo, kholo ka ho lekaneng ho lumela ntlha ea saw. Ke ne ke lebelletse hore ho be le khase e potlakileng ho tloha ho 'mele oa beke le beke. RÅna, lingaka, ba ileng ba tlameha ho ithuta likotsi tsa rona, re tlameha ho tloaela lintho tse joalo, 'me ke ile ka khutlela monyako. Empa moprofesa ha aa ka a emisa motsotsoana; 'Me o ile a bona ka mahlakoreng' maloa ka lehlakoreng le leng, le ka lehlakoreng le leng, 'me ka mor'a moo, le ka mose ho le leng. O ile a nka bohale ba flange e hlephileng, a e kobeha ho leba leotong la coffin, 'me a ts'oara kerese ka har'a perture, a tshisinyo ho 'na ho sheba.

tn: Go Go Gadget Coffin! O tla nna o sa ntse o na le bonnete jwa gore o tla nna o mo tshepa thata." Ka bonako fela a simolola go ntsha mesedi, mme kwa bofelong a tsholetsa lesedi, a supa fa a le kwa tlase. Matlho a me a ne a le mantsi thata mo go nna. Go ne go lebega e kete baswi ba ka bo ba ne ba sa ntse ba le mo borokong, fa ba ne ba robetse. Ke ne ka mo tshwara ka seatla go mo emisa. O ne a re: "O tla bona," mme gape o ne a tshwenya ka mokotleng wa gagwe, o ne a ntsha folofolo e nnye. O ne a dira gore ke nne le leswana le lennye le le kwa godimo, le le neng le dira gore ke se ka nna le lesodi le lennye, le le neng le le kwa godimo thata. Ke ne ke solofetse gore go ne go na le gase go tswa mo mmeleng wa beke e e fetileng. Dingaka tsa rona, tse di neng di tshwanetse go ithuta dikotsi tsa rona, re tshwanetse go tlwaela dilo tse di ntseng jalo, mme ke ne ka boela kwa kgorong. 'Morutabana ga a ka a ema sebakanyana' - The teacher is never stopped for a moment O ne a bona maoto a mabedi ka fa letlhakoreng le le lengwe la lesedi le le kwa godimo, mme morago ga moo, le fa tlase ga le lengwe. Fa a ne a le kwa tlase, a ya kwa morago ka fa tlase ga lesoko le le neng le le mo go lone, a nnaya ka fa tlase ga lesireletsa le le neng le le mo go lone, a nnaya ka fa tlase ga lesoko.

en: â€œTo open the coffin. You shall yet be convinced.â€ Straightway he began taking out the screws, and finally lifted off the lid, showing the casing of lead beneath. The sight was almost too much for me. It seemed to be as much an affront to the dead as it would have been to have stripped off her clothing in her sleep whilst living; I actually took hold of his hand to stop him. He only said: â€œYou shall see,â€ and again fumbling in his bag, took out a tiny fret-saw. Striking the turnscrew through the lead with a swift downward stab, which made me wince, he made a small hole, which was, however, big enough to admit the point of the saw. I had expected a rush of gas from the week-old corpse. We doctors, who have had to study our dangers, have to become accustomed to such things, and I drew back towards the door. But the Professor never stopped for a moment; he sawed down a couple of feet along one side of the lead coffin, and then across, and down the other side. Taking the edge of the loose flange, he bent it back towards the foot of the coffin, and holding up the candle into the aperture, motioned to me to look.

Ka mor'a rÅna, o ile a koala lemati 'me a koala. O ile a mpha senotlolo, a re: "Na u tla e boloka? Ho feta moo, o ile a tiisetsa. " Ke ile ka tÅ¡eha hore ha se ntho e monate haholo, empa ke ile ka re ke ile ka re o ile a etsa joalo. "Senotlolo ha se letho," ke ile ka re; "E ka 'na ea e-ba le li-duplicates; Leha ho le joalo, ho ke ke ha e-ba thata ho khetha mofuta oo. " Ha aa ka a re letho, empa a beha senotlolo ka pokothong ea hae. O ile a mpolella hore ke shebelletse ka lehlakoreng le leng la kereke ha a ne a tla sheba ka lehlakoreng le leng. Ke ile ka nka sebaka sa ka ka mor'a sefate sa yew,' me ke ile ka bona setÅ¡oantÅ¡o sa hae se lefifi se tsamaea ho fihlela majoe a hlooho a kenellang 'me lifate li e pata ponong ea ka.

tn: A boela a apara ka hara lesedi, a phutha dintho tsohle tsa hae, a di bea ka mokotleng, a letsa lesedi, mme a kenya le kerese ka mokotleng. Re ne ra bula lebati mme ra tswa. O ne a bula lebati a bo a e tswalela. O ne a mpha selotlolo sa gagwe a re: "A o tla e boloka? O ne a re tlhomamisetsa gore o tla nna botoka." I'm laughing so much and i'm laughing so much and i'll tell him. lolololololololololololol "Ga go na sepe se se ka se dirang," ga rialo Mme. ^ Gongwe go na le di-duplicate; 'Ga go thata go tsaya nÃ´nÃ´ ya mofuta o' - It is not easy to pick a type of that O ne a sa itse sepe, mme a tsenya senotlolo mo seatleng sa gagwe. O ne a nkopa gore ke nne mo letlhakoreng le lengwe la kereke fa a sa ntse a lebile kwa go le lengwe. Ke ne ka tsaya lefelo la me kwa morago ga setlhare sa me, mme ka bona tsela ya gagwe e e lefifi go fitlha kwa godimo ga matlapana a tlhogo e e mo gare mme ditlhare di e pata mo ponong ya me.

mg: Napetrany indray ny vatam-paty, nangoniny avokoa ny fananany rehetra ary napetrany tao anatin'ilay kitapo, notsofiny ny jiro ary napetrany tao anatin'ilay kitapo koa ilay labozia. Novohanay ny varavarana, dia nivoaka izahay. Nakatony ny varavarana ary nohidiany izany. Nomeny ahy ny fanalahidy, ka hoy izy: "Hotandremako ve ilay izy? Nahatoky kokoa ianao." Nihomehy ahoâ€”tsy dia nihomehy tamim-pifaliana loatra izany, tsy maintsy hiteny ahoâ€”raha nanao izay hihazonany izany aho. "Tsy misy dikany ny fanalahidy iray," hoy aho; "Mety misy duplicates; Ary na ahoana na ahoana dia tsy sarotra ny misafidy ny hidim-baravarana toy izany. " Tsy niteny na inona na inona izy, fa nametraka ny fanalahidy tao am-paosiny. Avy eo dia nasainy nijery teo amin'ny lafiny iray amin'ny tokotanin'ny fiangonana aho raha mbola nijery ny iray hafa izy. Naka ny toerako tao ambadiky ny hazo yaw aho, ary nahita ny endriny maizina nihetsika mandra-panafen'ireo vato sy hazo tsy ho hitan'ny masoko.

en: He put on the coffin-lid again, gathered up all his things and placed them in the bag, blew out the light, and placed the candle also in the bag. We opened the door, and went out. Behind us he closed the door and locked it. He handed me the key, saying: â€œWill you keep it? You had better be assured.â€ I laughedâ€”it was not a very cheerful laugh, I am bound to sayâ€”as I motioned him to keep it. â€œA key is nothing,â€ I said; â€œthere may be duplicates; and anyhow it is not difficult to pick a lock of that kind.â€ He said nothing, but put the key in his pocket. Then he told me to watch at one side of the churchyard whilst he would watch at the other. I took up my place behind a yew-tree, and I saw his dark figure move until the intervening headstones and trees hid it from my sight.

en: Outside the air was sweet, the sun shone, and the birds sang, and it seemed as if all nature were tuned to a different pitch. There was gladness and mirth and peace everywhere, for we were at rest ourselves on one account, and we were glad, though it was with a tempered joy.

mg: 30 Septambra: Tsara ny talen'ny gara ka nanome ahy tsipika ho an'ilay mpiara-mitory taminy taloha izay tompon'ny gara teo amin'ny Hazofijalian'ny Mpanjaka, ka rehefa tonga tany aho ny maraina dia afaka nanontany azy momba ny fahatongavan'ireo baoritra. Nifandray tamin'ny manam - pahefana koa aho, ary hitako fa marina ny tenin'izy ireo tamin'ilay faktiora tany am - boalohany. Voafetra ny fahafahana hahazo hetaheta tsy araka ny tokony ho izy; Na izany aza, nisy ny fampiasana tsara azy ireo, ary voatery niatrika ny vokatra tamin'ny fomba taloha aho.

en: 30 September.â€”The station-master was good enough to give me a line to his old companion the station-master at Kingâ€™s Cross, so that when I arrived there in the morning I was able to ask him about the arrival of the boxes. He, too, put me at once in communication with the proper officials, and I saw that their tally was correct with the original invoice. The opportunities of acquiring an abnormal thirst had been here limited; a noble use of them had, however, been made, and again I was compelled to deal with the result in an ex post facto manner.
es: 30 de septiembre. st: Ha ba ntse ba tsamaea, ho ne ho bonahala eka ba bang ba teng ba khopo ba ne ba tlohile, hobane lintja li ile tsa fefola 'me tsa phephetsa ka khathatseha ha ba ntse ba etsa litsuonyana tsa bona tsa tÅ¡ohanyetso,+ 'me tsa li fetola le ho li lahlela moeeng ka li-shakes tse mpe. Kaofela ha rÅna re ne re nahana hore meea ea rÅna e ntse e eketseha. Hore na e ne e le ho hloekisa moea o bolaeang ka ho buloa ha monyako oa ntlo ea chapel, kapa liphallelo tseo re bileng le tsona ka ho iphumana re le bulehileng ha ke tsebe; Empa ka sebele moriti oa tÅ¡abo o ne o bonahala o thella ho rona joalo ka seaparo, 'me ketsahalo ea ho tla ha rona e ile ea lahleheloa ke ntho e itseng ea bohlokoa ba eona, leha re sa ka ra qhekella whit qetong ea rona. Re koala monyako o kantle mme ra o koala, ra o koala, ra tlisa lintja le rona, ra qala ho batla ntlo. Ha rea ka ra fumana letho ho pholletsa le lerÅle ka likarolo tse sa tloaelehang, le poloko eohle e sa amaneng bakeng sa mehato ea ka ha ke ne ke entse ketelo ea ka ea pele. Ha ho mohla ntja e kileng ea bontÅ¡a matÅ¡oao leha e le afe a ho se phutholohe, 'me le ha re khutlela ka kamoreng eo ba neng ba e-na le eona e neng e le hore ba ne ba ntse ba tsoma mebutlanyana ka lehong la lehlabula.

tn: Ba ne ba re: "Ba ne ba sa ntse ba le mo tseleng e e bosula, ba ne ba dira gore ba se ka ba tlhola ba tsamaya, ba bo ba ba tshikinya mo phefong ka dithupa tse di bogale. Rotlhe re ne ra bona gore meya ya rona e a tlhatloga. E ne e le go itlhatswa ga phefo e e suleng ka go bula lebati la ntlo, kgotsa thuso e re neng re e bona fa re le mo teng ga rona, ga ke itse; Le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go lebega go na le sengwe se se neng sa re tshosa, mme re ne ra latlhegelwa ke sengwe sa dilo tse di neng di le botlhokwa thata mo go rona. Re ne ra bula lebati le le ka fa ntle mme ra tswalela, ra bo re tlisa dintÅ¡wa, ra simolola go batla ntlo. Ga re a ka ra bona sepe ka gope fa e se lerole ka selekanyo se se kgethegileng, mme tsotlhe tse di sa amaneng le dinao tsa me, fa ke ne ke etetse pele. en: With their going it seemed as if some evil presence had departed, for the dogs frisked about and barked merrily as they made sudden darts at their prostrate foes, and turned them over and over and tossed them in the air with vicious shakes. We all seemed to find our spirits rise. Whether it was the purifying of the deadly atmosphere by the opening of the chapel door, or the relief which we experienced by finding ourselves in the open I know not; but most certainly the shadow of dread seemed to slip from us like a robe, and the occasion of our coming lost something of its grim significance, though we did not slacken a whit in our resolution. We closed the outer door and barred and locked it, and bringing the dogs with us, began our search of the house. We found nothing throughout except dust in extraordinary proportions, and all untouched save for my own footsteps when I had made my first visit. Never once did the dogs exhibit any symptom of uneasiness, and even when we returned to the chapel they frisked about as though they had been rabbit-hunting in a summer wood.

Todos nosotros nos sentimos envalentonados. Ya fuera a causa de la purificaciÃ³n de la atmÃ³sfera de muerte, debido a que habÃ­amos abierto la puerta de la capilla, o por el alivio que sentimos al encontrarnos ante la abertura, no lo sÃ©; pero el caso es que la sombra del miedo pareciÃ³ abandonarnos, como si fuera un sudario, y la ocasiÃ³n de nuestra ida a la casa perdiÃ³ parte de su tÃ©trico significado, aunque no perdimos en absoluto nuestra resoluciÃ³n. Cerramos la puerta exterior, la atrancamos y corrimos los cerrojos; luego, llevando los perros con nosotros, comenzamos a registrar la casa. No encontramos otra cosa que polvo en grandes cantidades, y todo parecÃ­a no haber sido tocado en absoluto, exceptuando el rastro de mis pasos, que habÃ­a quedado de mi primera visita. Los perros no demostraron sÃ­ntomas de intranquilidad en ningÃºn momento, e incluso cuando regresamos a la capilla, continuaron jugueteando, como si estuvieran cazando conejos en el bosque, durante una noche de verano.

Dare mo ga shiranai, Re tshwanetse go nna re ritibetse e bile re tshwanetse go nna re ritibetse mmogo." O ne a didimetse mme a didimala, a inaa tlhogo ya monna wa gagwe mo tlhogong ya gagwe. E rile a sena go e tsosa, kobo ya gagwe e tshweu ya bosigo e ne e sweufaditswe ka madi a molomo wa gagwe, kwa molomo wa gagwe o neng o amile teng, le fa leswe le lesesane le le bulegileng mo molaleng wa gagwe le ne le ntsha marothodi. O ne a bona fa a ne a le kwa tlase, a bo a le kwa tlase, a lela, a fefolwa ke go fefolwa ke ditshika.

en: â€œDo not fear, my dear. We are here; and whilst this is close to you no foul thing can approach. When she raised it, his white night-robe was stained with blood where her lips had touched, and where the thin open wound in her neck had sent forth drops. The instant she saw it she drew back, with a low wail, and whispered, amidst choking sobs:â€”

st: Ho na le ba bang ba tla ema pakeng tsa hao le lefu. U ke ke ua shoa. U ke ke ua bolaea ka letsoho le leng le le leng; Bonyane ke ntho e 'ngoe le e' ngoe ka uena. Ho fihlela e mong, ea ileng a thetsoa bophelo ba hao bo monate, o 'nete o shoele, u se ke ua shoa; Etsoe haeba a ntse a le ka potlako Un-Dead, lefu la hao e ne e tla etsa hore u esita le joalokaha a ntse a. Che, u tlameha ho phela! U tlameha ho loanela le ho loanela ho phela, leha ho le joalo lefu le ka bonahala le sa khonehe. U tlameha ho loana lefu ka boeena, leha a ka tla ho uena ka bohloko kapa ka thabo; Bosiu kapa motÅ¡ehare; Polokeho kapa kotsing! Ka moea oa hao o phelang, Ke u laela hore u se ke ua shoa, kapa ua nahana ka lefu, ho fihlela bobe bona bo boholo e fetile. " Moratuoa ea futsanehileng o ile a hola a tÅ¡oeu joalo ka lefu, 'me a nyahatsoa le ho thothomela, ha ke ntse ke bona lebelo le sisinyehang ebe ke shaver nakong ea leqhubu le kenang. Bohle re ile ra khutsa; Ha ho letho leo re ka le etsang. Ha a le moo, o ile a khutsa le ho feta mme a re ho eena: "Oh, oh! 'Me o ne a sareloa ka mor'a hore a mo tÅ¡oere ka letsoho la hae.

tn: "Go na le bangwe ba ba tla emang fa gare ga lona le loso." Ka jalo, ga o a tshwanela go swa. O se ka wa swa ka seatla se le sengwe. bonyana bonyana ka wena 13Le fa e le yo mongwe yo o gopotseng bophelo jwa gago jo bo monate, o tla bo o sule, o se ka wa swa. Gonne fa a sa ntse a na le ba ba se kitlang ba bolawa, loso lwa gago lo tla lo dira jaaka a ntse. Nnyaa, o tshwanetse go tshela! O tshwanetse go lwela go tshela le go tshela, le fa go ka lebega go se na sepe se se sa kgonegeng. O tshwanetse go lwa le loso ka losi, le fa a tla kwa go wena ka bohutsana kgotsa ka boitumelo. motsheare kapa bosiu, Mo kotsing kgotsa mo kotsing! 18Ke go reile ka mowa wa gago o o tshelang gore o se ka wa swa, o se ka wa swa, o se ka wa gopola loso go fitlha bosula jo bogolo bo fetile. Ke ne ka simolola go nna le motho yo o neng a le mo mathateng, a bo a tshikinyega, a bo a tshikinya, a bo a le kwa tlase. Re ne ra didimala rotlhe. Ga re kake ra dira sepe. O ne a nna a ritibetse le go feta fa a ne a mo raya a re: "Ijoo! Ka jalo, o ne a tshwere ka seatla sa gagwe, fa a ne a sa ntse a le kwa morago.

mg: Misy ny sasany izay mitsangana eo anelanelanao sy ny fahafatesana. Tsy tokony ho faty ianao. Tsy ho faty amin'ny tanana akory ianareo; Ny [[Vatikana]] koa no [[firenena]] kely indrindra eto an-tany. Mandra-pahatongan'ny olon-kafa, izay nandoto ny malalanao, dia maty tokoa ianao, ka tsy ho faty ianao; fa raha mbola miaraka amin'ny Un-Dead, ny fahafatesanao no hahatonga anao ho tahaka azy. Tsia, tsy maintsy miaina ianao! Tsy maintsy miady sy miezaka ny ho velona ianao, na dia toa tsy hay lazaina aza ny fahafatesana. Tsy maintsy miady amin'ny fahafatesana ianao, na dia manatona anao amin'ny fanaintainana sy ny fifaliana aza izy; amin'ny antoandro, na amin'ny alina; Tandindomin-doza na tandindomin-doza! Ny fanahinao velona no ananarako anao mba tsy ho faty na hihevitra ny fahafatesana ianao mandra-pahalasan'izao loza lehibe izao. Nihalehibe fotsy toy ny fahafatesana ilay malala mahantra, ary taitra sy nihorohoro, satria nahita fihozongozonana sy horohoro haingana aho tamin'ny fahatongavan'ny ranomasina. Nangina izahay rehetra; Tsy afaka nanao na inona na inona izahay. Lasa tony kokoa izy tamin'ny farany ary nitodika tany aminy hoe: tsara, saingy oay! Tena nalahelo tokoa izy rehefa naninjitra ny tanany:-

en: â€œThere are here some who would stand between you and death. You must not die. You must not die by any hand; but least of all by your own. Until the other, who has fouled your sweet life, is true dead you must not die; for if he is still with the quick Un-Dead, your death would make you even as he is. No, you must live! You must struggle and strive to live, though death would seem a boon unspeakable. You must fight Death himself, though he come to you in pain or in joy; by the day, or the night; in safety or in peril! On your living soul I charge you that you do not dieâ€”nay, nor think of deathâ€”till this great evil be past.â€ The poor dear grew white as death, and shock and shivered, as I have seen a quicksand shake and shiver at the incoming of the tide. We were all silent; we could do nothing. At length she grew more calm and turning to him said, sweetly, but oh! so sorrowfully, as she held out her hand:â€”
es: â€“Hay aquÃ­ varias personas que se levantarÃ­an entre usted y la muerte. No debe usted morir de ninguna manera, y menos todavÃ­a por su propia mano. En tanto el otro, que ha intoxicado la dulzura de su vida, no haya muerto, no debe usted tampoco morir; porque si existe Ã©l todavÃ­a entre los muertos vivos, la muerte de usted la convertirÃ­a exactamente en lo mismo que es Ã©l. Â¡No! Â¡Debe usted vivir! Debe luchar y esforzarse por vivir, ya que la muerte serÃ­a un horror indecible. Debe usted luchar contra la muerte, tanto si le llega a usted en medio de la tristeza o de la alegrÃ­a; de dÃ­a o de noche; a salvo o en peligro. Â¡Por la salvaciÃ³n de su alma le ruego que no muera y que ni siquiera piense en la muerte, en tanto ese monstruo no haya dejado de existir! Mi pobre y adorada esposa se puso pÃ¡lida como un cadÃ¡ver y se estremeciÃ³ violentamente, como habÃ­a visto que se estremecÃ­an las arenas movedizas cuando alguien caÃ­a entre ellas. Todos guardÃ¡bamos silencio; nada podÃ­amos hacer. Finalmente, Mina se calmÃ³ un poco, se volviÃ³ hacia el profesor y dijo con dulzura, aunque con una infinita tristeza, mientras el doctor van Helsing le tomaba la mano:

st: "Jwale, metswalle, re nale mosebetsi mona hoka etsa seo. Re tlameha ho tlosa lefats'e lena, le halalelang la mehopolo e halalelang, eo a e tlisitseng naheng e hole bakeng sa ts'ebeliso e joalo e oeleng. O khethile lefatÅ¡e lena hobane lea halalela. Kahoo re mo hlÅla ka sebetsa sa hae, etsoe re etsa hore e be e halalelang haholoanyane. E ile ea halaletsoa ho batho ba joalo, hona joale re e halaletsa ho Molimo. " Ha a ntse a bua, o ile a nka mokotlana oa hae screwdriver le wrench, 'me kapele haholo ka holimo ho e' ngoe ea linyeoe e ile ea lahleloa e butsoe. Mobu o nkhang hamonate le o haufi; Empa ka tsela e itseng re ne re sa nahane, hobane re ne re tsepamisitse maikutlo ho moprofesa. O ile a nka lebokose la hae e le sekotoana sa Mohalaledi Wafer, a se bea lefatsheng, mme a koale sekwahelo sa qala ho seha hae, re mo thusa ha a ntse a sebetsa.

tn: "Bagaetsho, re na le tshwanelo ya go dira jalo. Re tshwanetse go tlosa lefatshe leno, le le boitshepo la dilo tse di boitshepo, tse a di tlisitseng mo lefatsheng le le kgakala gore le dirisiwe. O itlhaoletse lefatshe, ka gonne le ne le le boitshepo. Ke ka moo re mo fenyang ka sethunya sa gagwe; gonne re sa ntse re le boitshepo go feta. E ne e itshepisiwa mo bathong ba ba ntseng jalo, jaanong re e itshepisa mo Modimong." Fa a ntse a bua, o ne a tsaya lebokoso le lennye le lennye le lennye, mme go ise go ye kae, go ise go ye kae. Lefatshe le ne le okeditswe, le bo le le gaufi le lone; Le fa go ntse jalo, ga re a ka ra nna kelotlhoko ka gonne re ne re tlhomile mogopolo mo morutising wa rona. O ne a tsaya karolo e e tswang mo ntlong ya gagwe, a e baya mo lefatsheng, a e baya mo lefatsheng, mme morago ga moo a simolola go e robatsa ntlo ya gagwe, a mo thusa fa a ntse a dira.

mg: "Ankehitriny, ry namako, manana adidy eto izahay. Tsy maintsy manadio ity tany ity isika, izay masina tokoa amin'ny fahatsiarovana masina, ka nentiny avy any amin'ny tany lavitra mba ho azo ampiasaina toy izany. Nisafidy ity tany ity Izy satria masina. Ary dia hanodidina anao sy Manodidina anao manodidina. Nohamasinina ho amin'ny fampiasan'ny olona toy izany izy io, ary ankehitriny dia manamasina izany ho an'Andriamanitra isika." Rehefa niteny izy dia naka screwdriver sy wrench tao amin'ny kitapony, ary tsy ela dia nisokatra ny tampon'ny iray tamin'ireo tranga. Ny tany dia manimbolo sy manimbolo; Toa tsy nieritreritra anefa izahay, satria nifantoka tamin'ilay Mpampianatra ny saintsika. Nalainy avy tao amin'ny boatiny ny ampahan'ilay Fehezam-boninkazo Masina izay napetrany tamim-panajana teo amin'ny tany, ary avy eo dia nanakatonany ilay saron-tava dia nanomboka nandrovitra izany tany an-trano, nanampy azy izahay rehefa niasa.

en: â€œAnd now, my friends, we have a duty here to do. We must sterilise this earth, so sacred of holy memories, that he has brought from a far distant land for such fell use. He has chosen this earth because it has been holy. Thus we defeat him with his own weapon, for we make it more holy still. It was sanctified to such use of man, now we sanctify it to God.â€ As he spoke he took from his bag a screwdriver and a wrench, and very soon the top of one of the cases was thrown open. The earth smelled musty and close; but we did not somehow seem to mind, for our attention was concentrated on the Professor. Taking from his box a piece of the Sacred Wafer he laid it reverently on the earth, and then shutting down the lid began to screw it home, we aiding him as he worked.
es: â€“Ahora, amigos mÃ­os, tenemos aquÃ­ un deber que cumplir. Debemos esterilizar esta tierra, tan llena de sagradas reliquias, que la han traÃ­do desde tierras lejanas para poder usarla. Ha escogido esta tierra debido a que ha sido bendecida. Por consiguiente, vamos a derrotarlo con sus mismas armas, santificÃ¡ndola todavÃ­a mÃ¡s. Fue santificada para el uso del hombre, y ahora vamos a santificarla para Dios. Mientras hablaba, sacÃ³ del bolsillo un destornillador y una llave y, muy pronto, la tapa de una de las cajas fue levantada. La tierra tenÃ­a un olor desagradable, debido al tiempo que habÃ­a estado encerrada, pero eso no pareciÃ³ importarnos a ninguno de nosotros, ya que toda nuestra atenciÃ³n estaba concentrada en el profesor. Sacando del bolsillo un pedazo de la Hostia Sagrada, lo colocÃ³ reverentemente sobre la tierra y, luego, volviendo a colocar la tapa en su sitio, comenzÃ³ a ponerle otra vez los tornillos. Nosotros lo ayudamos en su trabajo.

tn: 13 [...]Jaaka a ne a le modiramolato, o a bo a le bogagapa; Le fa go ntse jalo, go na le dilo tse di sa tshwaneng le tse dingwe tse a di dirang e bile o na le boikgatshego jo bo sa tshwaneng le jwa gagwe, o ne a itewa ke bopelotshetlha. Boikaelelo joo ga bo na go ikwatlhaya. Fa a ne a le kwa morago, a tlogela masole a gagwe gore a se ka a kgaolwa, ka jalo o batla go nna a babalesegile, a sa tlhokomele botlhe. Ka jalo, bopelotshetlha jwa gagwe bo golola moya wa me mo nonofong e e boitshegang e a e boneng mo bosigong joo jo bo boitshegang. Ke ne ke ikutlwa jalo! Ke ne ke ikutlwa jalo! Re leboga Modimo, ka boutlwelo-botlhoko jo bogolo! 10Moya wa ka o lokolotswe go feta ka nako eo; Le fa go ntse jalo, go ka tswa go na le sengwe se ke se dirang gore ke se ka nna ka nna le poifo e kgolo mo go nna ka ntlha ya dilo tse a di dirileng kgotsa tse di sa ntseng di dira gore ke se ka nna ka di dira gore ke nne le kitso e e molemo." Tsy misy nenina izany tanjona izany. Rehefa nandositra an'i Danube izy, namela ny tafiny ho tapaka, noho izany dia mikasa ny ho voaro sy tsy hitandrina ny rehetra izy ankehitriny. Noho izany, ny fitiavan-tenany manokana dia manafaka ny fanahiko amin'ny hery mahatsiravina izay azony tamiko tamin'io alina mahatsiravina io. Tsapako izany! Tena tsapako izany! Misaotra an'Andriamanitra, noho ny famindram-pony lehibe! en: â€œThen, as he is criminal he is selfish; and as his intellect is small and his action is based on selfishness, he confines himself to one purpose. That purpose is remorseless. As he fled back over the Danube, leaving his forces to be cut to pieces, so now he is intent on being safe, careless of all. So his own selfishness frees my soul somewhat from the terrible power which he acquired over me on that dreadful night. I felt it! Oh, I felt it! Thank God, for His great mercy! My soul is freer than it has been since that awful hour; and all that haunts me is a fear lest in some trance or dream he may have used my knowledge for his ends.â€ The Professor stood up:â€”

AsÃ­, su propio egoÃ­smo libera a mi alma, hasta cierto punto, del terrible poder que adquiriÃ³ sobre mÃ­ aquella terrible noche. Â¡Lo siento! Â¡Oh, lo siento! st: Ke ne ke tseba hore ho na le bonyane mabitla a mararo a ho fumana li-otas tse nang le baahi; Kahoo ke batla, 'me ke fumana e' ngoe ea tsona. O ile a robala borokong ba hae ba vampire, a tletse bophelo le botle bo thata hoo ke neng ke le motle joalo ka ha eka ke tlil'o etsa polao. Oho, ha ke belaele hore nakong ea khale, ha lintho tse joalo li ne li le teng, monna ea neng a ikemiselitse ho etsa mosebetsi o joalo joalo ka oa ka, o fumanoeng qetellong pelo ea hae e mo hloleha, ebe oa hae oa moahela. Kahoo a lieha, 'me a liehe, 'me a liehe, ho fihlela botle feela le ho lisoa ke motho ea sa shoeng bafu ba hypnotise mo. 'Me o lula, ho fihlela letsatsi le likela, le vampire robala. Joale mahlo a matle a mosali ea hlokang leeme a buleha 'me a sheba lerato,+ 'me molomo o nonneng o hlahisang kako++ 'me monna o fokola. 'Me ho na le e' ngoe ea lihlatsitsi tse eketsehileng ka har'a li-vampire fold; Ê»O ka hoÊ»ohaÊ»ana i ka Ê»o Un-Dead...

tn: Ke ne ke itse gore go ne go na le diphupu tse tharo tse di ka nnang teng fa go na le diphupu tse di ka nnang teng. Ke batla, mme ke fumana e nngwe ya tsona. O ne a robetse, a bo a tletse bontle jwa me le bontle jo bo maswe jo ke bo dirileng gore ke se ka dira gore ke se ka ka nna le motho yo o neng a le mo go yone. Ke belaela gore mo motlheng wa bogologolo, fa dilo tse di ntseng jalo di ne di le dintsi, monna mongwe yo o neng a dira tiro e e ntseng jalo jaaka nna, yo o fitlhetsweng mo pelong ya gagwe ya bofelo, mme morago ga moo a mo tlogela. A diega, a diega, a diega, go fitlha bontle bo bo monate, le go kgatlhiwa ke yo o sa mo rateng. O ne a tswelela pele, go fitlha letsatsi le phirima, le fa letsatsi le phirima, le fa go ntse jalo, le fa letsatsi le phirima, le fa go ntse jalo, le fa go ntse jalo 18Foo matlho a mosadi yo o siameng a a bona lorato, mme molomo o o monate o o nang le kwa morago ga katla, mme motho o bokoa. 15 Go setse go na le motho yo o sa tlholeng a le mo go lone; Go go to the gros un-and-the-one of the un-dead...

en: I knew that there were at least three graves to findâ€”graves that are inhabit; so I search, and search, and I find one of them. She lay in her Vampire sleep, so full of life and voluptuous beauty that I shudder as though I have come to do murder. Ah, I doubt not that in old time, when such things were, many a man who set forth to do such a task as mine, found at the last his heart fail him, and then his nerve. So he delay, and delay, and delay, till the mere beauty and the fascination of the wanton Un-Dead have hypnotise him; and he remain on and on, till sunset come, and the Vampire sleep be over. Then the beautiful eyes of the fair woman open and look love, and the voluptuous mouth present to a kissâ€”and man is weak. And there remain one more victim in the Vampire fold; one more to swell the grim and grisly ranks of the Un-Dead!...

No pongo en duda que, en la antigÃ¼edad, a muchos hombres que se disponÃ­an a llevar a cabo una tarea como la mÃ­a les fallaran el corazÃ³n y los nervios. Por consiguiente, se retrasaba hasta que la misma belleza de la muerta viva lo hipnotizaba; y se quedaba allÃ­, hasta que llegaba la puesta del sol y cesaba el sueÃ±o del vampiro. Entonces, los hermosos ojos de la mujer vampiro se abrÃ­an y lo miraban llenos de amor, y los labios voluptuosos se entreabrÃ­an para besarâ€¦ El hombre es dÃ©bil.
